𐀡 po ⇔ π pi

𐀡 pierce open in 𐀀𐀜𐀡 a-no-po άνωπος without holes, not pierced

𐀡-𐀛-𐀑-𐀊 po-ni-ki-ja purple phoenix
𐀡-𐀛-𐀑-𐀍 po-ni-ki-jo palm tree
𐀡-𐀃-𐀁-𐀐-𐀳-𐀪-𐀊 po-o-e-ke-te-ri-ja pokers, nippers

𐀡-𐀫 po-ro foals Fohlen πῶλος pôlos, Latin pullus Albanian pelë “mare” 𓄤 𓂋 𓏏 𓃒 𓏥 parade פָּרָה pará > bull

𐀡-𐀕-𐀚 po-me-ne ⲣⲉϥⲁⲙⲟⲛⲓ m. shepherd 𓃀 𓍢 𓇩 𓏠 𓈖 𓀸 ⋍ 𓊪 𓅮 𓄿 𓏠 𓈖 𓀸
𓏠 𓈖 𓃒 𓀸 ⲙⲁⲛⲉⲥⲱⲟⲩ manager, man-of-cows, shepherd (√ⲙⲁⲛⲓ herd)

𐀡-𐀬- po-ru poly-…
𐀡-𐀬-𐀡-𐀆 po-ru-po-de octopus

𐀡-𐀮-𐀅-𐀃 po-se-da-o Poseidon
𐀡-𐀯-𐀅-𐀂-𐀍 po-si-da-i-jo temple of poseidon (Ναός του Ποσειδώνα)
𐀡-𐀯-𐀅-𐀂-𐀋-𐀄-𐀯 po-si-da-i-je-u-si priests in the sanctuary of Poseidon

𐀡-𐀯-𐀐-𐀳-𐀩 po-si-ke-te-re •class of men: 'suppliants' is an unlikely meaning perhaps 'newcomers'? ⇔ ἰκέτης patricians?

𐀡-𐀴-𐀛-𐀊 po-ti-ni-ja mistress
𐀡-𐀴-𐀫 po-ti-ro boaters, sailors
